ai-sn50:55-66.0.2_0: 6. Another Chapter of Abbreviated Texts on the Ganges, Etc.
ai-sn50:55-66.1.1_0: “Mendicants, suppose that, although the Ganges river slants, slopes, and inclines to the east,
ai-sn50:55-66.1.2_0: In the same way, a mendicant who develops and cultivates the five powers slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.
ai-sn50:55-66.1.3_0: And how does a mendicant who develops the five powers slant, slope, and incline to extinguishment?
ai-sn50:55-66.1.4_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the powers of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom, which culminate in the removal of greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-sn50:55-66.1.5_0: That’s how a mendicant who develops and cultivates the five powers slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.”
ai-sn50:55-66.1.8_0: The sixth sub-chapter on succession is finished.
